arguments.description: List of files or directories to check
arguments.name: FILES

metadata.description: Run Ruff on the given files or directories

options.description: Apply fixes to resolve lint violations. Use `--no-fix` to disable or `--unsafe-fixes` to include unsafe fixes
options.name: --fix

options.description: Include fixes that may not retain the original intent of the code. Use `--no-unsafe-fixes` to disable
options.name: --unsafe-fixes

options.description: Show an enumeration of all fixed lint violations. Use `--no-show-fixes` to disable
options.name: --show-fixes

options.description: Avoid writing any fixed files back; instead, output a diff for each changed file to stdout, and exit 0 if there are no diffs. Implies `--fix-only`
options.name: --diff

options.description: Run in watch mode by re-running whenever files change
options.name: --watch

options.description: Apply fixes to resolve lint violations, but don't report on, or exit non-zero for, leftover violations. Implies `--fix`. Use `--no-fix-only` to disable or `--unsafe-fixes` to include unsafe fixes
options.name: --fix-only

options.description: Ignore any `# noqa` comments
options.name: --ignore-noqa

options.description: Output serialization format for violations. The default serialization format is "full" [env: RUFF_OUTPUT_FORMAT=] [possible values: concise, full, json, json-lines, junit, grouped, github, gitlab, pylint, rdjson, azure, sarif]
options.name: --output-format

options.description: Specify file to write the linter output to (default: stdout) [env: RUFF_OUTPUT_FILE=]
options.name: --output-file

options.description: The minimum Python version that should be supported [possible values: py37, py38, py39, py310, py311, py312, py313]
options.name: --target-version

options.description: Enable preview mode; checks will include unstable rules and fixes. Use `--no-preview` to disable
options.name: --preview

options.description: List of mappings from file extension to language (one of `python`, `ipynb`, `pyi`). For example, to treat `.ipy` files as IPython notebooks, use `--extension ipy:ipynb`
options.name: --extension

options.description: Show counts for every rule with at least one violation
options.name: --statistics

options.description: Enable automatic additions of `noqa` directives to failing lines
options.name: --add-noqa

options.description: See the files Ruff will be run against with the current settings
options.name: --show-files

options.description: See the settings Ruff will use to lint a given Python file
options.name: --show-settings

options.description: Print help
options.name: --help

options.description: Comma-separated list of rule codes to enable (or ALL, to enable all rules)
options.name: --select

options.description: Comma-separated list of rule codes to disable
options.name: --ignore

options.description: Like --select, but adds additional rule codes on top of those already specified
options.name: --extend-select

options.description: List of mappings from file pattern to code to exclude
options.name: --per-file-ignores

options.description: Like `--per-file-ignores`, but adds additional ignores on top of those already specified
options.name: --extend-per-file-ignores

options.description: List of rule codes to treat as eligible for fix. Only applicable when fix itself is enabled (e.g., via `--fix`)
options.name: --fixable

options.description: List of rule codes to treat as ineligible for fix. Only applicable when fix itself is enabled (e.g., via `--fix`)
options.name: --unfixable

options.description: Like --fixable, but adds additional rule codes on top of those already specified
options.name: --extend-fixable

options.description: List of paths, used to omit files and/or directories from analysis
options.name: --exclude

options.description: Like --exclude, but adds additional files and directories on top of those already excluded
options.name: --extend-exclude

options.description: Respect file exclusions via `.gitignore` and other standard ignore files. Use `--no-respect-gitignore` to disable
options.name: --respect-gitignore

options.description: Enforce exclusions, even for paths passed to Ruff directly on the command-line. Use `--no-force-exclude` to disable
options.name: --force-exclude

options.description: Disable cache reads [env: RUFF_NO_CACHE=]
options.name: --no-cache

options.description: Path to the cache directory [env: RUFF_CACHE_DIR=/run/user/1000/ruff]
options.name: --cache-dir

options.description: The name of the file when passing it through stdin
options.name: --stdin-filename

options.description: Exit with status code "0", even upon detecting lint violations
options.name: --exit-zero

options.description: Exit with a non-zero status code if any files were modified via fix, even if no lint violations remain
options.name: --exit-non-zero-on-fix

options.description: Enable verbose logging
options.name: --verbose

options.description: Print diagnostics, but nothing else
options.name: --quiet

options.description: Disable all logging (but still exit with status code "1" upon detecting diagnostics)
options.name: --silent

options.description: Either a path to a TOML configuration file (`pyproject.toml` or `ruff.toml`), or a TOML `<KEY> = <VALUE>` pair (such as you might find in a `ruff.toml` configuration file) overriding a specific configuration option. Overrides of individual settings using this option always take precedence over all configuration files, including configuration files that were also specified using `--config`
options.name: --config

options.description: Ignore all configuration files
options.name: --isolated
